name: Kismet Cave House

reviews.text: Staying at Kismet Cave hotel was a great experience for us. Faruk is a wonderful host, full of information about sightseeing and life in Cappadocia. The hotel is beaufitully decorated and our room was cosy, warm (we stayed in winter) and full of beautiful furnitures. The boys enjoyed the Underground City and making snowmen. We hope to come back to this amazing part of Turkey one day.
reviews.title: beautiful cave hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Kismet Cave House was a real special place for our Cappadocia visit. Just outside Goreme center, this hotel was perfect for us. Great fresh breakfast. Two minute walk to Goreme shops, restaurants, bus station. Faruk, owner and host, is most accommodating. Please spend some time with him if you have the chance. Very kind. Quite witty and fun. And he's a Yul Brynner look-a-like!
reviews.title: Lovely place, wonderful host
Highly recommended
reviews.text: This review, my first on TripAdvisor, is long overdue. However, I can't recommend Kismet Cave House more highly. The hotel itself is very comfortable, and breakfast on the terrace looking out over Goreme is a wonderful way to start the day. What makes this place truely special though is the owner, Faruk, who is the most hospitable host I have ever come across. Faruk spent much of his time with us, taking us on walks and driving us to places of interest, and it was this that made our time in Cappadocia so memorable. I hope to return to Cappadocia and, if I do, I will be staying at Kismet Cave House.

This small hotel is a gem. The rooms are beautifully decorated and furnished in traditional style (I had the Tulip Room upstairs). They are comfortable and clean - the most comfortable bed I had in Turkey! Bathrooms are modern and clean - mine even had a spa bath. But the bonus of Kismet Cave House is the owner, Faruk, who served me very good breakfasts and went out of his way to make sure that I enjoyed my stay in Cappadocia and saw everything of interest in the region. On the second day the private driver/guide was ill, so Faruk gave up his day to be my personal driver/guide/lunch host. He gave me an interesting day of varied experiences and from his conversation I certainly learned more about Turkey than I could from the guide book. Cannot recommend more highly.
reviews.title: A perfect place to stay

reviews.text: Travelled with our 9 year old daughter. Actually we celebrated her 9th Bday at Kismet with Faruk, his boys and other guests. Our stay at Kismet was nice . We were in Daisy Cave room . The room was spacious and the temperature inside the room was perfect to make us comfortable. As it was a cave room , it had a slight volcanic smell, which we got used to after some time. Faruk was always around to help and every discussion was supported by a cup of tea :). The breakfast is simple, mostly home made stuff and fresh fruits from the garden. Our stay would have been totally fantastic and Excellent , if we didnt end up at the wrong airport while leaving Cappadocia :). Its important to understand that Cappadocia doesnt have its own airport , its served by two nearby airport ( Kayseri & Nevsehir ). Luckily we managed to find another flight from that airport in time to catch our connecting flight from Istanbul .
reviews.title: Simple , Homely and Nice Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is about the 5th time I am writing this (and posting it) – for some reason it never got posted thus the delay.
reviews.title: Very welcoming and hospitable

reviews.text: How can one describe Kismet Cave House? As most people say – very hospitable and welcoming. Faruk (and family) makes you feel like you are a guest at their house. How would one describe Faruk? He is a salesman, businessman, politician and diplomat all out together in a nice way.
reviews.title: Excellent choice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First and foremost, he was the only one that replied to my e-mail that had a vacancy. Others that replied did not have a vacancy for my dates. The rest – business must be good – never heard from them.
reviews.title: Great place to stay!

reviews.text: We stayed at the Tulip room, one of the rooms with a Jacuzzi. It is cave room both the room and bathroom were spacious and clean, but basic. It is upstairs next to the terrace where people have breakfast. If you are inside keep the blinds closed. From what I understand each room is very different and some much smaller than the Tulip room – so in essence this is a review of the room. In my opinion the room rate is on the high side but the service is great.
reviews.title: wonderful, warm, welcoming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got to Cappadocia in an early morning flight, Faruk had someone pick us up and take us to the Hotel. We must have got there about 8:00 – 8:30a. Faruk greeted us, dropped off the luggage in the lobby and asked us to come upstairs and have breakfast. Keep in mind we are supposed to check in at around 2:00p, and this morning’s breakfast was not part of the deal. He got the room ready for us and we were in the room before noon.
reviews.title: Cappadocia and Kismet: a rare beauty

reviews.text: We had a great time with the owner, Faruk, and his brother Yusuf. Great people. They were so helpful in getting us organized for our stay. The rooms were very nice, clean, and comfortable. Some of the rooms are built into the rock, some are not. The location is just on the edge of town leaving Göreme going up to Üçhısar. You can very easily walk to the town center where all the restaurants are.
reviews.title: Very nice place, well run

reviews.text: Overall, a very enjoyable hotel.
reviews.title: Kismet Cave House - true Turkish hospitality at its best !

reviews.text: I travelled to Cappadocia with my wife and 2 children and we had the most delightful stay at Kismet Cave House in Goreme. Mr. Faruk Keles, the owner of this this property is a very people friendly gentleman and for him Kismet Cave House is more than just a business, it is his passion. This is evident in the way he has very artistically decorated his property, and, the Lilac Cave Room that we stayed in was truly beautifully and tastefully done up. Mr. Faruk provided us 5-star attention and personally took us around everywhere (Ulchisar, Kaymakli, Museum's, Valley drives, .....) in his car and made arrangements for a lovely hot-air balloon ride, an adventurous trek in Love Valley and our bus transportation to Antalya. Kismet Cave House is very well located, just 5 minutes walk from central Goreme. Knowing Mr. Faruk was truly a pleasure and I would recommend Kismet Cave House very strongly for an enjoyable family vacation in Cappadocia.
reviews.title: Magical Kismet

reviews.text: Kismet Cave House is everything you need in a hotel...clean room, comfortable bed, hot water, charming decor, great breakfast and reliable wifi. And Owner Faruk is the icing on the cake! Faruk takes the time to get to know all of his guests, and spends time understanding their sightseeing needs. He speaks English well, and gives you honest advice about tours, etc.
reviews.title: Sincerely

reviews.text: Staff very sincere and helpful. Breakfast was fine. Unlimited tea and food. Beautiful setting. Faruk and his sons, who were helpful and good. Beautiful setting, warm hospitality of the people and the Turkish
reviews.title: Serendipity in Goreme

reviews.text: What a pleasant surprise! This was our first trip to Turkey and the Cappadocia region (mid December 2012). When we first arrived (mom, dad and our two daughters who are 23 and 21), the entrance and room did not quite look like the web site and we were a little concerned. All that faded away as we were warmly greeted by the Kismet Cave House owner, Faruk Keles, who brought us into his cozy office to have Chai, Apple Tea and Turkish Delights. Faruk is a wonderful host whose main interest is to make you feel welcome to his Cave House. He grew up in Gerome so he knows everybody as well as the area around Cappadocia. He arranged for local tours and a Turkish bath for our family. The Cappadocia region has some very wonderful and unique scenery and great hiking, some of which is in walking distance from his cave house. One night he recommended a local restaurant run by a local family. Wow, what a treat! The mother cooks dinner on a wood oven and the bread is out of this world. Faruk joined us for dinner as did the mother and son who own the restaurant. Faruk was our interpreter and it was a magical evening. Breakfast was included and was simple but delicious. Faruk prepared a delicious breakfast of fruits, breads, cheeses, spreads, yogurt and eggs to order every morning, served in the basement of the cave house. The hotel bedrooms are clean and comfortable, but not elegant. If you are looking for a modern elegant establishment, this is not the place. But, if you want to be treated to the warmth and culture of the Cappadocia region, look no further than that offered by Faruk and the Cave House.
reviews.title: Central Turkey Charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I had a fantastic time in Cappadocia thanks to Faruk at Kismet and Samet at Soandos Travel.
reviews.title: Kismet + Soandos Travel = Amazing time in Cappadocia!

reviews.text: Faruk is very helpful and super friendly - it was my husband's birthday while we were staying at Kismet and Faruk sent his son to find some balloons and helped decorate the breakfast room to surprise my husband in the morning. It was very sweet and kind of him. The warmth, cosiness and fantastic service makes a stay at Kismet very special.
reviews.title: An intimate experience

reviews.text: Samet is the friendliest and most attentive guide we've had on this trip! We did the Green tour with Samet and enjoyed it so much we did the Red tour with Samet the next day. Having a funny, honest and patient tour with Samet made such a difference! Faruk organised the tours with Soandos for us.
reviews.title: Absolutely brilliant!!

reviews.text: The amazing experience with these 2 businesses inspired me to do my first ever Tripadvisor post! I can't recommend them both enough :)
reviews.title: Amasing

description: Our 8 beautiful rooms are pleasantly and elegantly decorated in warm, soft colours with antique furnishings and private en-suite bathrooms, natural air conditioning and cozy down duvets. Each room offers its own special romantic atmosphere and an escape from the ordinary. Two of the double rooms are also lavished with jacuzzis, one of them is extra special - which we call the honeymoon suite, this also has a fireplace to create that special atmosphere. The quad room is actually a spacious family room complete with fireplace and jacuzzi.
